definition: Confucius
hole/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for cave dwellings
surname Kong
mound/hillock/grave/classifier for fields
surname Qiu

sentences.english: Confucianism, the bore Qiu initiated the lofty spirit of morals docile.
sentences.chinese: 儒家，孔丘倡導了道德善良的崇高精神。

sentences.english: Zilu and others surprised, they looked toward Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 孔丘與子路等人看，宥坐垂直。

sentences.english: Confucius, Zilu and others watch and the stool becomes upright.
sentences.chinese: 孔丘與子路等人看，宥坐垂直。

definition: Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
the Sage Confucius
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Confucius (551-479 BC), Chinese thinker and social philosopher, also known as 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Yan Hui (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius, also known as Yan Yuan 顏淵|颜渊[Yan2 Yuan1]
Yan Yuan (521-481 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as 顏回|颜回[Yan2 Hui2]
Confucius and Mencius
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
Mencius 孟子 (c. 372-c. 289), Confucian philosopher
Master/(old form of address for teachers, scholars)/pedant
Confucius' school (i.e. his direct disciples)
Zi Lu (542-480 BC), disciple of Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3], also known as Ji Lu 季路[Ji4 Lu4]
Zi Gong or Duanmu Ci 端木賜|端木赐[Duan1 mu4 Ci4] (520 BC-), disciple of Confucius
original name of Mozi 墨子[Mo4 zi3]
courtesy name for Confucius 孔夫子[Kong3 fu1 zi3]
